If you're craving an experience akin to The Elder Scrolls on Mobile, this is about as good as it gets!!  Taking inspiration from this and other modern and classical open world rpgs, but adding its own flair and rich texture into the mix, a unique combat system, engaging witty characters and a deep and satisfying role playing experience, The Quest is an imaginative, expansive and addictive portable game.  The game world, Lore, and mythology is exciting and with a consistent, old school feel this game captures the spirit of 90s adventure games but adds a few modern twists.  Casual gamers may find this offering a bit too difficult to pick up, simply due to the amount of options and possibilities on offer, and although the movement and control can feel a bit stiff for modern tastes, there are very few if any other mobile role playing games that pack in so much content for your money.  Can't recommend highly enough, and if the price feels a bit steep rest assured it is easily worth your money!

Loved the gameplay and graphics.  Sadly the juvenile sexual content ruined what would have otherwise been a fantastic retro ode to some of the old CRPGs I loved as a kid.  The game seems utterly obsessed with sexual promiscuity - in just the first few hours of gameplay you'll encounter several prostitutes, an Amazon queen who propositions you, a quest regarding a wife who ran out on her husband to live with "perfect and muscular" bandits, another to retrieve a book for an alchemist who left it at the brothel before his wife finds out, an astrologer whose insights about the various birth signs (and there are many) literally all involve an explanation of what people born under them find sexually pleasing, not to mention the content in the brothel itself.  There's nothing real  *visually* explicit, but there's enough text to nearly qualify as mild erotica.  I'm sure the list would go on, but I gave up and uninstalled the game.  If you're like me then by now you've read enough to know to steer clear of this game, but if you love old school CRPGs and are thinking "what's the big deal?", then you'll probably love this game.

This game is much better than the dozens others android rpgs I tried and usually immediately gave up after half an hour. A little light on text/story for now, the quests being rather basic in their plots, but I haven't gone past the second town yet so it might change. Inventory management is alright, I can store stuff inside containers, and the stuff hasn't disappeared yet, so I hope they are permanent storage (earlier I had stored my stuff in the Matras storeroom, which seemed perfect with all its containers in close proximity and with its door to the town, but some time later I found the path walled off and had to reload a much earlier save to get my items back >.<). The ability to put notes on the map is very useful, though it would be even better if you could put notes of several colors instead of just green ones, so for example you could tell apart immediately the notes you put about npcs, those about monsters, and those about doors and portals. The common monsters are supposed to respawn, which is good, but I haven't found that to be the case except with monsters in caves (or maybe it takes a lot longer for those on the main map ?). I was happy to find plenty of herbs to pick up, but I cleaned those around the first two towns very quickly and sadly after 25 in-game days they haven't respawned anywhere, so I don't know if they are supposed to. Also, there are some bugs, two of which were especially annoying. The first appeared after a few days and was a constant crash of Google Play Services when the game starts and tries to login to Google Play Games before accessing cloud storage, which caused an error in the login process, and no connection to Google Play and no cloud storage. It disappeared when I did a factory data reset on my tablet after manually copying my saved files and hasn't reappeared, at least not yet. The second is still there to annoy me : one of the first quests is to find a boy (Onan I think ?) near Matras for the agent recruiter, and I ignored it for some time as I wanted to explore a bit. When I finally got around to do it, I talked to the boy, conviced him, when to his brother, and then back to the boy who agreed to let me lead him to the recruiter and disappeared. So far so good, but once I went back to the recruiter's house, I did not have any conversation topic concerning the boy, the only options being "Why are you here", "about the village", "about the governor", and "hail to Mersant". Therefore I can't finish this quest, even though it is still active in my journal.

Same great game I remember on iOS, but the new graphics really make it shine here! Hoping like crazy that they release all the add-on/additional content as well!

Hope y'all add the expansions to android as well :)

Just an amazing little gem. Reminds me of old school Might and Magic, except it's a party of one instead of 4+. Plays great, music is great, ambiance is great. What can I say? It's just great! I know I'll be playing this one for a while. Definitely worth the price.

content: This is one of the best RPG-s available for mobile, and one of the greatest on any platform. Glad it was ported to Android. I've encountered some problems, but the developer is great and everything is sorted now. Well worth the price. Thank you!

I've never heard of this game (googling the rather generic name gives some funny results) so it's new to this Android gamer, but goodness. What a brilliant piece of work. People say it's reminiscent of older Elder Scrolls games but I also get warm flashbacks to the original Might and Magic games, Wizardry and Eye of the Beholder. It's crazy to think this is the work of a two person team. Worth every cent. Thanks redshift. You rock.
Thank you guys for porting the quest to Android, I sorely missed it when I made the switch. My main concern though is if/when you port the dlc, will I have to purchase again like the quest gold?

For anyone who loves games like old school Elder Scrolls games or maybe DnD themed RPGs this is a fantastic title. The art is beautiful and the animations look oldschool yet clean and adapted well for mobile. Looking forward to sinking hours into this one!

There WAS a book in this game called "The Creature in the Cave" which directly mirrored H.P. Lovecraft's "The Beast in the Cave" with no reference or credit for his original work, but now it has been updated to "The Creature in the Forest" with your own poetic words. Thank you. This game is fantastic 5/5
replyContent: We were completely unaware of this. The book has now been removed.

content: I played this years ago on my old iPhone. My only regret when I switched to android was that this game was not available. Now it is. Thank the gods!
The developer has done a great job with this game. Has an old school RPG feel but enough substance and modern features to bring this game current. Great job!

I briefly played The Quest years ago on a friend's device.  I was enthralled with the smooth game play and world complexity that felt instantly akin to the original Elder Scrolls games.  The translation to HD graphics and smoother animation is a welcome addition.  I couldn't recommend games like this more for mobile platforms.  Perhaps my only criticism would be the occasional frame rate drop when the environmental effects start.

Undoubtedly my favourite RPG. The huge world along with extensive characters/traits and the *enormous* alchemy simply puts this one above all others. Huge playability factor, and I sometimes just turn it on just to play the in-game card game!

Absolutely wonderful Retro-RPG.  It reminds me a lot of daggerfall and other games around that time.  Big open world with *plenty* of stuff to do which is usually my criticism of open-world games.  Exploration feels natural and there's always something to explore.  I've already spent hours in the first city even though the main quest recommends you go to a new city almost immediately, I just have so many side quests to complete!

Been waiting years for this to come to Android. I played it on PocketPC years ago. Love the nostalgia value of it. As for the actual port of it, the only issue I've had so far is the a black screen at startup. It's an easy fix, tab out to anything and tab back in. My only other concern is the availability of the expansions. Are those included, will they be in a future update, or will they be DLC? It would also be nice to have some interface updates, such as bigger movement controls.

I originally played a version of this on a different OS, very glad it made the transition and the graphics and playability have really improved. Was happy to find this game and even happier to be able to support the developer. A lot of fun and a complex rpg in its own rite

I've never played this game before, but as a huge fan of games like it, I was excited to give it a go after reading all the rave reviews here and elsewhere. I like the game's content (and there is a LOT of it!), but would love to see a better control scheme offered. Specifically, either controller or external keyboard support (I prefer controller, but since this is also on PC, keyboard would be okay also). Needing to hit various on screen directional buttons over and over again to move is really awkward, especially on a tablet (difficult to hold for long periods, awkward to use in an upright stand). With better controls, this would be a five star, top notch game, for sure! As is, I'll give it four stars, simply because of the tremendous amount and quality of content available.
